Blight.description: Leaf blight causes elongated gray or tan lesions that dry the leaf.
Blight.prevention: Use resistant hybrids and rotate crops.
Blight.Season: Corn grows best in warm temperatures, between 60°F and 95°F (15°C to 35°C). The ideal planting time is late spring to early summer.
Blight.Fertilizer: Apply a nitrogen-rich fertilizer (like 28-0-0) when the plants are 6-8 inches tall, and again when they reach knee-high for maximum yield.
Blight.Soil: Corn thrives in well-drained, fertile soil with a pH between 5.8 and 7.0. Ensure the soil has plenty of organic matter.

Common_Rust.description: Reddish-brown pustules appear on both sides of the leaf.
Common_Rust.Season: Corn grows best in warm temperatures, between 60°F and 95°F (15°C to 35°C). The ideal planting time is late spring to early summer.
Common_Rust.Fertilizer: Apply a nitrogen-rich fertilizer (like 28-0-0) when the plants are 6-8 inches tall, and again when they reach knee-high for maximum yield.
Common_Rust.Soil: Corn thrives in well-drained, fertile soil with a pH between 5.8 and 7.0. Ensure the soil has plenty of organic matter.

Gray_Leaf_Spot.description: Rectangular gray lesions that block sunlight and reduce yield.
Gray_Leaf_Spot.treatment: Apply fungicides at tasseling if needed.
Gray_Leaf_Spot.prevention: Crop rotation and tilling can help reduce spores.
Gray_Leaf_Spot.Season: Corn grows best in warm temperatures, between 60°F and 95°F (15°C to 35°C). The ideal planting time is late spring to early summer.
Gray_Leaf_Spot.Fertilizer: Apply a nitrogen-rich fertilizer (like 28-0-0) when the plants are 6-8 inches tall, and again when they reach knee-high for maximum yield.
Gray_Leaf_Spot.Soil: Corn thrives in well-drained, fertile soil with a pH between 5.8 and 7.0. Ensure the soil has plenty of organic matter.

Healthy.description: The corn plant is healthy with no signs of disease.
Healthy.Season: Corn grows best in warm temperatures, between 60°F and 95°F (15°C to 35°C). The ideal planting time is late spring to early summer.
Healthy.Fertilizer: Apply a nitrogen-rich fertilizer (like 28-0-0) when the plants are 6-8 inches tall, and again when they reach knee-high for maximum yield.
Healthy.Soil: Corn thrives in well-drained, fertile soil with a pH between 5.8 and 7.0. Ensure the soil has plenty of organic matter.
